Package com.github.oeuvres.alix.util

Class EdgeMatrix

java.lang.Object
com.github.oeuvres.alix.util.EdgeMatrix
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<Edge>
public class EdgeMatrix extends Object implements Iterable<Edge>
A matrix to record edges between predefined node Ids. Ex: nodeValues = {10,3,6}. Record events like (3,6)++, (6,3)++, (-1,6)++. If this recorder is not directed, (3,6) == (6,3), so that (3,6) == 2. -1 is not a value in the node list, (-1,6) will not be recorded.

  • Constructor Details

    • EdgeMatrix

      public EdgeMatrix(int[] nodeValues, boolean directed)
      Build matrix with a limited set of accepted values for nodes. If this recorder is not directed, (3,6) == (6,3).
      Parameters:
      nodeValues - A list of ints.
      directed - true if direction should be kept in pairs.

  • Method Details

    • inc

      public boolean inc(int sourceValue, int targetValue)
      Increment a cell if both node values are in the set of accepted values nodeLookup, or do nothing and return false if at least one value is not found.
      Parameters:
      sourceValue - to search in nodeLookup.
      targetValue - to search in nodeLookup.
      Returns:
      true if values found and increment done, false otherwise.

    • incByIndex

      protected int incByIndex(int sourceIndex, int targetIndex)
      Expert, modify a cell by node index, more efficient if lookup has been done by caller.
      Parameters:
      sourceIndex - source node index in nodeLookup.
      targetIndex - target node index in nodeLookup.
      Returns:
      new value

    • nodeIndex

      public int nodeIndex(int nodeValue)
      Get the nodeIndex of a nodeValue. Returns a negative index if the value is not found in nodeLookup, like Arrays.binarySearch(int[], int).
      Parameters:
      nodeValue - a node value, possibly not accepted.
      Returns:
      nodeIndex in nodeLookup, or negative value if not found.

    • nodeLookup

      public int[] nodeLookup()
      Expert, return a pointer on the nodeLookup table, useful to ensure nodeCounts(long[]).
      Returns:
      set of sorted unique nodeValues.

    • nodeCounts

      protected EdgeMatrix nodeCounts(long[] counts)
      Expert, set counts per node to calculate a score. counts[index] = count for nodeLookup[index].
      Parameters:
      counts - global count per node.
      Returns:
      this.

    • set

      public boolean set(int sourceValue, int targetValue, int cellValue)
      Set count for a cell if both node values are in the set of accepted values nodeLookup, or do nothing and return false if at least one node value is not found.
      Parameters:
      sourceValue - to search in nodeLookup.
      targetValue - to search in nodeLookup.
      cellValue - value to set for pair.
      Returns:
      true if values found and cell modified, false otherwise.

    • setByIndex

      protected int setByIndex(int sourceIndex, int targetIndex, int cellValue)
      Expert, set a cell by node index, more efficient if lookup already done by caller on same nodeLookup.
      Parameters:
      sourceIndex - source node index in nodeLookup.
      targetIndex - target node index in nodeLookup.
      cellValue - value to set for pair.
      Returns:
      old value.
